oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written to Mr. F. M. James by his brother Pvt. G. W. James, Co. F, 12th/47th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. G. W. James, Co. F, 12th/47th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, writes this letter to his brother F.M. James. He writes, "I am thankful to God, that I survive the third battle unhurt,-One ball hit my hat at Richmond, Ky-I have heard you speak of battles in other days and speak of this civil war and who should fight it, but little did I think I would experience it so soon." G. W. James enlisted in the 12th Tenn. at Humboldt in March 1862. The regiment was consolidated with the 47th Tenn. in 1862.
